Annotation.String: This is the schema definition for the Volume resource. It represents the properties for logical disk drives for any system.
This resource shall be used to represent a volume, virtual disk, logical disk, LUN, or other logical storage for a Redfish implementation.
The type of initialization to be performed
This defines the property name for the action.
This action is used to prepare the contents of the volume for use by the system.
This defines the name of the custom action supported on this resource.
This action is used to force a check of the Volume's parity or redundant data to ensure it matches calculated values.
This defines the name of the custom action supported on this resource.
The volume is prepared for use quickly, typically by erasing just the begining and end of the space so that partitioning can be performed
The volume is prepared for use slowly, typically by completely erasing the volume
The size in bytes of this Volume
This property shall contain the size in bytes of the associated volume.
Is this drive currently predicting a failure in the near future
This property shall contain failure information as defined by the manufacturer for the associated drive.
Is this Volume encrypted
This property shall contain a boolean indicator if the Volume is currently utilizing encryption or not.
The type of encryption used by this Volume
This property shall contain the type of encryption used by this Volume.
The Durable names for the volume
This property shall contain a list of all known durable names for the associated volume.
The size of the smallest addressible unit (Block) of this volume in bytes
This property shall contain size of the smallest addressible unit of the associated volume.
The links object contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Actions object contains the available custom actions on this resource.
An array of references to the drives which contain this volume. This will reference Drives that either wholly or only partly contain this volume.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resource that this volume is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Drive.
The volume is a raw physical device without any RAID or other virtualization applied
The volume is a non-redundant storage device
The volume is a mirrored device
The volume is a device which uses parity to retain redundant information
The volume is a spanned set of mirrored devices
The volume is a spanned set of devices which uses parity to retain redundant information
The volume is utilizing the native drive encryption capabilities of the drive hardware
The volume is being encrypted by the storage controller entity
The volume is being encrypted by software running on the system or the operating system
